alert.note: Alert for Pearl River; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 12:22AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL WASHINGTON PARISH, SOUTHEASTERN WALTHALL AND NORTHWESTERN PEARL RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 100 AM CST... At 1221 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds 8 miles east of Franklinton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bogalusa, Poplarville, Varnado, Enon, Crossroads, and Angie. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CST for southeastern Louisiana...and southern Mississippi.
